content:
https://juliacommunity.github.io/zulip-archive/stream/274208-helpdesk-(published)/topic/.60eachline(.3A.3AIOBuffer).60.20for.20other.20delimiters.html
Looks like the archiver is balking on ` backticks. Is there a reason dots are used instead of url encoding?

https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/zulip-archive/blob/master/274208-helpdesk-(published)/topic/.60eachline(.3A.3AIOBuffer).60.20for.20other.20delimiters.html looks correct too, is GH pages freaking out somehow?

On first glance this seems to be where the dots are introduced after the URL encoding: https://github.com/zulip/zulip-archive/blob/bcd29a173500de778e70a304fc40cdffaec78803/lib/url.py#L62-L64

Could you open an issue in that repo, please?
Hmm, the encoding looks fine/consistent but the link itself 404s despite that. Is it because of the leading .?

Apparently jekyll ignores those and zulip-archive doesn't have a nojekyll file by default: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/20893913/does-pages-github-com-support-directory-names-with-a-preceeding-dot/20910276#20910276

Still worth opening an issue in the repo. I'll see if I can manually fix it somehow (the archive tool overwrites the repo contents which makes it a bit tricky to customise)

If you haven't seen it yet, issue is at https://github.com/zulip/zulip-archive/issues/51. If indeed the repo is being completely overwritten at every iteration, would it be easier to change the slug generation logic and wait for it to propogate? I'm certainly in no rush to browse the archive.
This topic was moved by Mason Protter to #zulip-bridged > Escaping issues in the archive
